comment: I took his A&P 1 Lab. He's very nice and was very clear with what you should study for the exams. Only 3 exams and lab always ended early. Do every Pre and Post lab to help keep your grade up. Just take him he's great.

Dr. Hamdan is seriously the nicest professor Ive had at KSU. He is super knowledgeable and is willing to help you with content. He is super lecture heavy, but SI sessions are so helpful. Be ready to read and study outside of class, tests are difficult but he always curves them. I promise if you talk to him he will make sure everything turns out ok.

Just finished the class and loved it overall. It is hard to understand him sometimes with his accent but he really wants us to succeed and is very approachable. He left assignments open for weeks and there was even a little extra credit. I say take him, he isn't as bad as ppl make it seem. 4 exams, one final and plenty of hw to balance your grade.

Professor Hamdan was a good lecturer in my opinion. He explains the concepts well. The class itself was extremely hard, but not unbearable. He answers any questions you may have. His exams were a little confusing sometimes, but you just have to study a lot to understand the material well.

please just don't take him. i took this class knowing i would have to study, but no matter how much i study i fail every exam. he also selectively responds to emails and switches up due dates for assignments a lot and will not reopen them for you. he's a nice man, but just not a good professor.
Most caring knowledgeable professor i have ever had. Down to earth and approachable. Will hold you responsible for the work. Students love him.
if you do your part you will be in good shape. yes he is tough but we all love him to death all his fall classes are now full and the waiting list is soooooooooo long

Dr. Hamdan is one of the best teachers I've had so far. He really knows what he's talking about and cares a lot about the subjects he teaches. He explains what you need to do in the class so there's no confusion. As long as you do your work and show up to class, he'll do whatever he can to help you succeed. Dr. Hamdan is a great part of KSU.

He's great overall! Okay… he's definitely not easy, but if you actually want to learn, this is the class for you! There are pre-lecture (online and open book) and post-lecture quizzes every time. He repeats key terms a lot, so they really stick. Just read the book, use his study guides, and take good notes. I got an A in both lecture and lab.

I had Dr. Hamdan for lab last spring, and he was really knowledgeable and made everything so engaging. I honestly miss his teaching style. He truly prepares you for a career in the medical field. If you have the chance, take his class—you won't regret it!

Dr. Hamdan is hands down the best teacher I've ever had! He expects you to read ahead but thoroughly explains anything unclear. His passion for the subject is unmatched, and he's always willing to help. He ensures you're well-prepared for exams and your future career. Truly knowledgeable—an incredible and inspiring educator!

Best teacher ever!! I totally recommend him to everyone. He explains things old-school by writing on the board instead of just using PowerPoints. His analogies and examples make everything way easier to understand. Love his teaching style!!

Dr. Hamdan is the best teacher I've ever had! He expects you to read ahead but explains everything clearly if you don't get it. Super passionate, always willing to help, and truly prepares you for exams and your career. He knows his stuff—an awesome, inspirational teacher!

Dr. Hamdan is a great teacher because he taught me a very important lesson—WORK HARD and DON'T MAKE EXCUSES. Now that I'm in a nursing program, I see how his teaching style sets me apart. He made us put in real effort to earn our grades, and that mindset is preparing me for real life, where there aren't always study guides or worksheets.

I actually really enjoyed this class and did well! Yeah, it was tough, but the material was super detailed and helpful. The exams required understanding, not just memorizing slides. I also had no issue reaching out for help through office hours and email. If you put in the effort, it pays off

He's honestly pretty cool. People complain about the knowledge checks, but if you attend class and pay attention, it's manageable. He really cares about us learning and, as an MD, knows his stuff. The checks help reinforce what we learn. It's all about putting in the effort, and he's there to help us succeed.

Okay, let's be real, this professor is definitely not handing out participation trophies. But honestly, we need that tough love to grow. Every class feels like a boot camp for life, but somehow, we walk out with more knowledge than we came in with. Prepare for some stressful moments, but trust me, it pays off in the end.

very reasonable when grading, quizzes are open note and due day of exam every time for lecture, gives u abt a month to do the quizzes, and u have multiple attempts. Because of how long the quizzes are open he doesn't give extra time to do them bc u can have around 30 days to do all which is plentyyyyyyyy. Love Dr. Hamdan!!!!!!!!!!! #stopthehate

I took him for lecture and lab, and his lab was better. His lectures are very long with 100+ slides per chapter and difficult wording, so I don't recommend him for lecture. What I do recommend is his lab. It was short and you were free to ask questions and he would personally explain the concepts to you. Very sweet guy!
Don't take this guy. Worst professor. Gives 400 slides worth of study material just for you to study the wrong thing.

First of all, I just completed this class and see all of the negative reviews listed below... like 10 people in my class got caught cheating lol so i think they are salty and trying to get back at him. Dr. Hamdan is an amazing professor, very knowledgeable, and helpful. At the end of the day this is just a hard class that requires a lot of work.

I took him for A&P I and II. I barely passed both times. His test are VERY heavy on material. To study, you'll be reading about 300-500 slides for exams. There is weekly homework and in class assignments. I only passed one test out of 10 test I've taken combined for I and II. I wish he gave us study guides. We need a form of guidance, seriously.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: This is for his LAB. His lab is fine, he just goes by the standard content that the department wants students to learn. He teachers a little bit from the powerpoint and lets u leave after he is done teaching, so basically you don't need to stay for the whole 3 hours of class. But I did stay to study the models to prepare for the exam.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: Ended up switching my major because of how hard this class was. There's no winning with this man. Doesn't even count towards my credits anymore. This class brought my GPA down for no reason whatsoever.
He gives you like 400 slides to study yet none of them show up on the exams. I would study day in and day out and still end up with 40's and 50's on his exams. Just awful.

Half of my class including me failed nearly all of our exams. extremely hard. he expects you to memorize 400-500 slides worth of information and doesn't even give you a study guide with what type of material is going to be on those exams. 0/10 do not recommend.
Lots of homework and busy work. No matter how hard you study, you will NOT pass this class. Don't even think about it
Impossible professor. Exams are nothing like the materials in class. Gives 400 slides worth of powerpoints yet none of them show up on the exams, even if you study hard.

I would not take this professor again! He didn't follow the syllabus schedule, so many of our tests were on different days and pushed back. He would change the study material for each test, so it was difficult to know what you really should be studying. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but he did start doing knowledge checks.

Professor is impossible to work with. Beginning of semester he said attendance was not mandatory but switched it around after midterms. Gives 400 slides per unit and chooses material on exams at random. Does not give study guides and can be very moody.

I took this professor last year, and should not have taken him again. At the beginning of the year he told us attendance was not mandatory, but then gave us required knowledge checks in class. He does not give clear instructions of what topics are going to be on the exam. No matter how hard you study you will not pass. DO NOT take him!

I've taken this professor twice and I should've learned the first time. His tests are hard to study for. I literally never know what to study. He gives us these open note knowledge checks on random days even though he says attendance isn't mandatory. Hardly responds to emails, keeps pushing back the test dates and no one knows when our next one is.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Said attendance wasn't necessary but would give us random quizzes. He makes us guess when the test is going to be, it is very unorganized. it is VERY strict on tests, and none of the questions matched the McGraw Hill practice quizzes he gives us(even though he said they would be similar). No matter how hard you study you won't pass his class.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: He is very unorganized and goes back on things he says. Started the semester saying that the exams were straight from the quizzes then changes after the first exam to his own questions which were overly specific. Said it was our fault when half the class failed his exam. Doesn't care about his students and is unpredictable,  making A&P much harder.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He is the worst professor I have ever had! He has changed how he is grading assignments many times. He is all lecture, his words roll into on another, he skips slides that are on the exams, and he skips units to go to other ones for a day. He is very unorganized. Do not take him unless you want to teach yourself anp 2.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He has a nice personality but when it comes to teaching he could be a lot better. To start, every unit is 2-3 chapters(not the problem) but his powerpoints are 100+ slides each. The Mcgrawhill questions that he assigns tend to not be relevant to the topics on the test.I would never take him again but he does curve the test on occasion.

Prof. Hamdan is great. He has lots of experience and is extremely knowledgeable in all things A&P. He relates lecture content with clinical settings. Although he is great, if you want a good grade it is entirely on you. If you don't read the book, if you don't do the practice exams and practice quizzes 5-10 times plus, don't expect an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: I took this class twice, as well as lab, and Prof. Hamdan was AMAZING! I got an A in both. His humor gives you the laugh you need to get through class since it's heavy. Those who say he's bad, didn't put in enough effort. Its a hard subject. Study the PowerPoint slides he tells you to and the pre exams and you'll do fine.

Lab is pretty individual and you do 90% of the work on your own. My only complaint is that he would start class an hour early and give those students an in-depth lecture, and give those who arrived on time a run-down few minute lecture. Also made some rude comments sometimes, made me a lil insecure, but overall helpful and will answer questions.

I recommend taking him he doesnt make you feel dumb for not knowing something. He will make sure you understand material. This is a hard class though. He does take points away if you do not attend labs but it is not manadtory. He offers extra credit which is nice. The exams are hard so make sure you study.

Anatomy itself is a hard class, what he does is start out fast paced because the earlier material is easier than the later. His teaching pace is overwhelming but he does this so for the harder material its easier to review. Attendance isn't mandatory but he'll give out extra credit as much as he can for it. Hard class, easy lab, Good Prof!

My main problem is that I tried to make up a test that I missed and he told me to be there at a certain time, but he ended out just leaving and not being there at that time. When I contacted him to see what was going on, he basically told me that it was my fault and ignored the other messages I sent which caused me to end the class with a bad grade

He is a nice person, however as a teacher I wouldn't recommend him to anyone! I studied for hours and still failed his exams. He assigns chapter quizzes and practice exams, but it doesn't matter if you get an A on all of them if you don't pass the exams you won't pass the class. If it came down to taking him or waiting to take A&P I would just wait
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I wouldn't take this professor again; he is the sole reason I changed my major. He's incredibly kind and cares about you as a person, but before we tested on Chapters 1-4, we were already on Chapter 9! I was studying roughly 70 hours a week just to fail the exam, and there were barely any grades. If you take him, good luck; you're going to need it.

Very nice and helpful professor! He is always willing to take time outside of class to answer questions and help. He will also go through EXACTLY what will be on tests and content you need to know. Very much lecture heavy but worth taking him!!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Only take if you are willing to do the work! TBH do not take anatomy if you are not going to work for your grade. Weekly quizzes, four tests and final. Four pre-exams. He is the sweetest guy ever. Will meet you outside of class to answer questions. Does review an hour before class. Uses McGraw. Multiple attempts on pre-exams and quizzes. Uses ppts.

I love this professor. A and P is a fast-paced course, so if you do not stay on top of it, you will get behind. You HAVE TO STUDY. He is very open to questions, available to talk to before and after class, and is super caring. I am taking Chem 1152 with this class and have an A. Test are in person on paper and quizzes are online, with 2-3 attempts.

Took him for A&P1. Genuinely the worst professor I have ever had. Doesn't teach, sat and flipped through a powerpoint just highlighting things. Zero explanation, little to no expansion of what was on the powerpoint. He makes his own tests that have almost zero correlation to any of the study materials or quizzes. 0/10, would never take again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He has been the best lab professor I've taken so far! I love how he interacts with us, asks us questions, and shows us individually a diagram or display. If you don't understand something he will explain until you get it.

I was nervous after seeing "meh" reviews, but after many lab professors, his class was by far my favorite. He is the most understanding, caring, & amazing professor. If I could take him for every class 100% I would. He gives very CLEAR criteria of what is expected on exams. Structured like every other lab & is just the best class. TAKE HIM PLEASE!!
